publications.title: Modelling the effectiveness of Far-UVC (222 nm) light for reducing airborne pathogen transmission in occupied rooms
publications.abstract: Far-UVC light at 222 nm has emerged as a promising technology for inactivating airborne pathogens while remaining safe for human exposure. This study develops a computational framework combining CFD-based airflow simulation with pathogen transport and UV dose-response modelling to evaluate the effectiveness of Far-UVC in reducing infection transmission risk in occupied spaces. Results demonstrate that Far-UVC can achieve equivalent air changes of 20–30 ACH under typical operating conditions, significantly outperforming conventional ventilation strategies.

publications.title: Bioaerosol deposition in single and multi-bed hospital wards: A numerical simulation study
publications.abstract: Hospital-acquired infections represent a significant burden on healthcare systems worldwide. This study employs high-resolution computational fluid dynamics to simulate the transport and deposition of respiratory bioaerosols in realistic hospital ward geometries. We compare single-bed isolation rooms with open multi-bed Nightingale-style wards under varying ventilation configurations.

publications.title: Quantifying the role of fomites in SARS-CoV-2 transmission: A stochastic network model
publications.journal: Journal of the Royal Society Interface
publications.abstract: Surface contamination has been hypothesized as a secondary transmission route for respiratory viruses. We develop a stochastic network model coupling human touch behavior, viral persistence on materials, and dose-response relationships to quantify fomite-mediated transmission risk in indoor environments.

publications.title: Lattice Boltzmann simulation of airflow and particle transport in complex hospital geometries
publications.abstract: Traditional CFD methods face computational challenges when simulating transient airflow in complex indoor geometries with moving boundaries. This paper presents a GPU-accelerated lattice Boltzmann method coupled with Lagrangian particle tracking for efficient simulation of respiratory aerosol transport in hospital environments.

publications.title: The role of ventilation in controlling SARS-CoV-2 transmission: A systematic review
publications.abstract: This systematic review synthesizes evidence on the relationship between ventilation rates and respiratory infection transmission in indoor environments. Analysis of 47 studies spanning healthcare, educational, and residential settings reveals a consistent inverse relationship between ventilation rate and infection incidence.
